discourseTypes.title: Letter Writing
discourseTypes.subtitle: Formal & Informal Letters
discourseTypes.description: Master the art of formal and informal letter writing with proper structure, tone, and formatting guidelines.
rules: Always include your address at the top right
Date should be written below your address
Use formal language for business letters

practiceItems.title: Job Application Letter
practiceItems.prompt: Write a formal letter applying for a part-time job at a local bookstore. Include your qualifications, availability, and enthusiasm for the position.
guidelines: Show enthusiasm for reading and customer service
practiceItems.template:
Your Address
City, State ZIP Code
Date

The Manager
Bookstore Name
Address

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to apply for...

Yours faithfully,
[Your name]

practiceItems.title: Complaint Letter to School
practiceItems.prompt: Write a formal complaint letter to your school principal about inadequate library facilities.
practiceItems.template:
Your Address
Date

The Principal
School Name
Address

Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to bring to your attention...

Yours faithfully,
[Your name]

practiceItems.title: Informal Letter to Friend
practiceItems.prompt: Write an informal letter to your friend describing your recent school trip to a historical monument.
practiceItems.template:
Your Address
Date

Dear [Friend's name],

How are you? I hope you're doing well...

With love,
[Your name]

discourseTypes.title: Email Writing
discourseTypes.subtitle: Professional & Personal
discourseTypes.description: Learn to write effective professional and personal emails with proper etiquette and formatting.
rules: Always include a clear subject line
Keep emails concise and to the point
Use bullet points for multiple items

practiceItems.title: Professional Email to Teacher
practiceItems.prompt: Write an email to your teacher requesting an extension for your assignment due to illness.
practiceItems.template:
Subject: Assignment Extension Request - [Your Name]

Dear [Teacher's Name],

I hope this email finds you well...

Best regards,
[Your Name]

practiceItems.title: Email Inquiry to Company
practiceItems.prompt: Write a professional email inquiring about internship opportunities at a technology company.
practiceItems.template:
Subject: Internship Inquiry - [Your Field] Student

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to inquire about...

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

discourseTypes.title: Diary Entry
discourseTypes.subtitle: Personal Reflections
discourseTypes.description: Express your thoughts, feelings, and experiences through personal diary writing with authentic voice and reflection.
rules: Always start with date and sometimes time
Be honest about feelings and thoughts
Include sensory details to make entries vivid
Reflect on experiences and lessons learned

practiceItems.title: First Day at New School
practiceItems.prompt: Write a diary entry about your first day at a new school, including your feelings, observations, and experiences.
guidelines: Describe your emotions before and during the day
Mention interactions with teachers and students
Reflect on challenges and positive moments
Express hopes or concerns for the future
practiceItems.template:
Dear Diary,

Date: [Today's date]

Today was my first day at...

I'm feeling...

Until tomorrow,
[Your name]

practiceItems.title: Achievement and Success
practiceItems.prompt: Write about a recent achievement or success you experienced, reflecting on the journey and what you learned.
guidelines: Explain the effort and process behind it
Express your emotions about the success
Consider what this means for your future goals
practiceItems.template:
Dear Diary,

Date: [Today's date]

I can't believe it - I finally...

Looking back on the journey...

With gratitude,
[Your name]

practiceItems.title: Difficult Decision
practiceItems.prompt: Write about a difficult decision you had to make recently, exploring your thought process and feelings.
guidelines: Explain the situation and options available
Express your doubts, fears, and hopes
Consider the perspectives of others involved
Reflect on the values that guided your choice
practiceItems.template:
Dear Diary,

Date: [Today's date]

I've been wrestling with a decision...

After much thought...

Hoping for the best,
[Your name]

discourseTypes.title: Essay Writing
discourseTypes.subtitle: Academic & Opinion Essays
discourseTypes.description: Develop strong essay writing skills with proper structure, argumentation, and evidence-based reasoning.
rules: Use topic sentences for each paragraph

practiceItems.title: Advantages of Online Learning
practiceItems.prompt: Write a 300-word essay discussing the advantages of online learning for students.
guidelines: Use specific examples to support points
practiceItems.template:
Introduction: Hook + Background + Thesis
Body Paragraph 1: First advantage + examples
Body Paragraph 2: Second advantage + examples  
Body Paragraph 3: Third advantage + examples
Conclusion: Restate thesis + final thoughts

discourseTypes.title: Speech Writing
discourseTypes.subtitle: Public Speaking & Presentations
discourseTypes.description: Craft compelling speeches and presentations with proper structure, rhetorical devices, and audience engagement.
keyComponents: Memorable conclusion with call to action
rules: Use the rule of three for main points
End with a strong call to action

practiceItems.title: School Environment Day Speech
practiceItems.prompt: Write a 3-minute speech for your school's Environment Day celebration, encouraging students to adopt eco-friendly practices.
guidelines: Start with an environmental fact or question
Include a personal story or example
End with an inspiring call to action
practiceItems.template:
Opening Hook: [Environmental fact/question]
Main Point 1: [First eco-action]
Main Point 2: [Second eco-action]
Main Point 3: [Third eco-action]
Conclusion: [Call to action]

discourseTypes.title: CV/Resume
discourseTypes.subtitle: Professional Documents
discourseTypes.description: Create professional CVs and resumes that effectively showcase your skills, experience, and qualifications.
rules: Use action verbs to describe achievements

practiceItems.title: Student CV for Part-time Job
practiceItems.prompt: Create a CV for applying to part-time jobs while studying, highlighting your academic achievements and transferable skills.
guidelines: Include any volunteer work or projects
practiceItems.template:
[Full Name]
[Contact Information]

Personal Statement:
[2-3 sentences]

Education:
[School/College details]

Skills:
[Relevant abilities]

Experience:
[Any work/volunteer experience]

general: Read your work aloud to check flow

punctuation: Use commas to separate items in a list
Use semicolons to connect related independent clauses
Use apostrophes for contractions and possession
capitalization: Capitalize the first word of sentences
Capitalize the first word after a colon in formal writing
Capitalize titles when they precede names
common_mistakes: Its vs. It's - possession vs. contraction
Their, There, They're - possession, location, contraction
Your vs. You're - possession vs. contraction
Affect vs. Effect - verb vs. noun
